metadata.synopsis:
General Note: Shadowheart is a potential avatar or companion. She is a worshipper of the dark goddess Shar, sent on a secret mission, the purpose of which is pivotal to the overall plot. The full truth of what she's up to will only be revealed over time.
Situation Summary: The same as the player, Shadowheart has just survived the Nautiloid crash. Prior to this, she was also kidnapped by the mind flayers and tadpoled. Now the player encounters her a short distance from the crash wreckage, trying to break down an ancient door set in the bottom of a cliff face. Around her are several dead intellect devourers - she's had to defend herself since the crash. Becoming aware of the player, she recognises a fellow survivor, and the fact that they too are tadpoled. She explains that she's trying to get through the door in search of supplies or shelter. The player has a chance to suggest they team up and try to survive. She's cagey about other matters when asked - she seems unwilling or unable to go into her background in any great detail.
If the player encountered her during the tutorial section, she'll react to this (including whether they tried to help her or not). If the player is githyanki, she'll be more aggressive and difficult to win over.JLatino: It's important to remember that SH is tired, exhausted and along. She just survived the crash of an alien vessel on which she was held prisoner. She's sizing the player up as a threat, while knowing she doesn't have a lot in the tank to fight back if it comes to it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load Wld_Main_A- Recon: goto 285, 288- Approach Shadowheart at the door

281.speaker: Shadowheart
281.text: Wait... you're the one who left me to die on the ship.
281.context: CinematicNodeContext: Narrows her eyes accusingly.NodeContext: Recognition. Narrows her eyes accusingly. This isn't just some random potential threat approaching, but someone who abandoned her in a life or death situation,

372.speaker: Narrator
372.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Anger. Bitterness. A will to survive.*

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: ...Agh! Did you feel that? You've got the same thing - in your head...

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Did you miss the part where we were hurtling through the Hells? I had to save myself.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Excuses. You didn't even try. You just ran.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Left you to die? I don't have a clue what you mean.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: You know. You looked me right in the eyes, then ran.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: As if you would have done differently.

155.speaker: Lae'zel
155.text: As if you would have done differently.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: I'm not the coward here, flatface.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: No matter. We survived the Hells, survived the crash.

320.speaker: Shadowheart
320.text: No matter. We survived the Hells, survived the crash.

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: But we mightn't survive these things in our heads. They're going to consume us from the inside and turn us into mind flayers.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: You know about mind flayers? Tell me everything.

269.speaker: Shadowheart
269.text: I don't know much, but enough to be afraid. This is how they breed. We host their spawn, and once they're ready, they'll tear right through us.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: But I feel fine, all things considered... are you sure?

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: I'm sure enough. This is how the mind flayers breed. We host their spawn, and once they're ready, they'll tear right through us.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Calm down. We escaped - we survived. There's no need for dramatics.

260.speaker: Shadowheart
260.text: I wish I was being dramatic. This is how the mind flayers breed. We host their spawn, and once they're ready, they'll tear right through us.

323.speaker: Shadowheart
323.text: I'm not sure how much time we have left, but I'm not going to wait to find out.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: You and I need a healer.

303.speaker: Shadowheart
303.text: Finding one won't be easy in this wilderness. We'll need supplies.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: I was hoping to search through this door for something of use...

294.speaker: Shadowheart
294.text: But it looks like you've beaten me to it.

296.speaker: Shadowheart
296.text: I'm hoping something of use might be behind this door...

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: But I've barely made a dent in it so far.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Looks like you need a hand.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: Be my guest, but that door's too strong. Maybe there's another way, up the cliff.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: Hopefully there's no more of these things...
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures towards the nearby dead intellect devourers as she says 'things'.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I doubt this is the only entrance. You could look elsewhere.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I was thinking the same thing... around the top of this cliff perhaps.
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

158.speaker: Shadowheart
158.text: Hopefully there's no more of these creatures along the way.
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures towards the nearby dead intellect devourers as she says creatures

140.speaker: Player
140.text: It'd be nice to have another hand in the fight.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Highlights dead interllect devourers nearby.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: From what I can see, looks like you handle yourself just fine.
324.context: CinematicNodeContext: Highlights dead interllect devourers nearby.

358.speaker: Shadowheart
358.text: For now. But I'd rather get out of here than keep testing my mettle against these things.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Do you know if anyone else survived the crash? There were lots of people in those pods.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: No, unless you count these monsters.

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: You're the friendliest face so far.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Alliances have been made on less. I could use your help.

264.speaker: Shadowheart
264.text: Or just company for our final moments.

310.speaker: Shadowheart
310.text: But you're right - whatever lies ahead will be a little less daunting with support.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: I might've considered it... but your choice of company so far leaves a great deal to be desired.
71.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

225.speaker: Shadowheart
225.text: Get rid of the gith. Then we can talk about helping each other.
225.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: I offer you cleansing. You'd cast it aside for this shka'keth?
270.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: I offer you cleansing. You'd cast it aside for this shka'keth?
39.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: This seems personal. What did Lae'zel do to you?
36.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: This seems personal. What did Lae'zel do to you?
243.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

349.speaker: Shadowheart
349.text: Her kind can't be trusted - they just tried to kill us aboard that ship, after all.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: We all have these things in our heads. There must be a way to work this out.
31.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: Must there? You wouldn't expect a wolf and a deer to find a way to work together.
24.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

188.speaker: Shadowheart
188.text: She'll turn on you. You'll see.
188.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm far worse than her, but you need us both.
82.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'm not worried about a traitor. I'm worried about these tadpoles.
64.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: We'll just keep her in front as arrow fodder. How about that?
44.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

367.speaker: Lae'zel
367.text: ... this is a terrible idea. But I suppose there is some sense in what you say.
367.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: ... this is a terrible idea. But I suppose there is some sense in what you say.
87.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: This one is trouble. Watch your back, as she's likely to stab it.
257.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

251.speaker: Lae'zel
251.text: This one is trouble. Watch your back, as she's likely to stab it.
251.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I'll keep an eye on the gith.
217.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: I'll keep an eye on the gith.
20.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

363.speaker: Shadowheart
363.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Something in me tells I'm 'The Dark Urge'.
104.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I am sometimes called the Blade of Frontiers. But you should call me Wyll.
201.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: Uh-huh... Wyll it is then. Let's move.

200.speaker: Player
200.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

236.speaker: Player
236.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

110.speaker: Player
110.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: Wait. Perhaps we shouldn't. You're not the one I need to talk to, are you? Not really.
194.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: I saw it, in your head. You follow someone else's orders. I'll deal with them, not you.

307.speaker: Player
307.text: Fine. I'll see about introducing you.

265.speaker: Shadowheart
265.text: I have to get moving. Perhaps our paths will cross again later.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Wait - after all that, you won't join me?

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: Oh I'll join you. If you have whoever's in charge alongside you. Otherwise, I'd best be on my way.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: You know, I think I'd rather take my chances without you.

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: Perhaps we'll meet again. If you survive, that is.

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: I'd join you... but things are looking a tad crowded. You'll need to make room for me.
15.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

244.speaker: Shadowheart
244.text: A bit crowded, don't you think? You'll need to swap out someone if you want me.
244.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: All right. Meet me at camp.
119.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.
283.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

255.speaker: Narrator
255.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*
255.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

231.speaker: Narrator
231.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

182.speaker: Player
182.text: If I must. But do try to keep them safe - they're a little useless without me.
182.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

190.speaker: Astarion
190.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
190.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Gale could do with a rest.
159.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: Wonderful. I was beginning to feel a little left out.

127.speaker: Player
127.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: Aw! Why me?! Guess I'll just sit on my thumb in camp then.
165.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

291.speaker: Player
291.text: Aw! Why me?! Guess I'll just sit on my thumb in camp then.
291.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

301.speaker: Karlach
301.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

215.speaker: Narrator
215.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: Off I go. You'll know where to find me!

365.speaker: Player
365.text: Off I go. You'll know where to find me!

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

337.speaker: Shadowheart
337.text: You seem overburdened with hangers-on already.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: I'll mark my camp on your map. You can rest there.

107.speaker: Shadowheart
107.text: You're a marauder from another world, dolt - of course my name will seem foreign to you. Stay focused.

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: After everything you've been through, my name gives you pause? Please.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: True enough. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - we'd better get moving.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Two half-elves walking around together. Everyone's going to think we're cousins.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: What do you know of my kind? Our matters on this plane are well-concealed.

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: I know enough to know I have to keep an eye on you.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: A fine name; strong and without pity. We will see if you live up to it.

370.speaker: Shadowheart
370.text: Stick around and you might find out.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: Call me [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. We best make haste.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: How did you end up on the ship in the first place?

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: That... is none of your business. I suggest we concentrate on surviving.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Much was lost to my mind, but my name is: [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

239.speaker: Player
239.text: The name's Gale. I'm sure the pleasure will be mutual.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I am Lae'zel. Daughter of Gith. Warrior of Vlaakith.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I am sometimes called the Blade of Frontiers. But you should call me Wyll.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: I'm Astarion. And you should know... I'm a vampire spawn.

174.speaker: Shadowheart
174.text: Very funny. And I'm a bugbear. We'll get along just fine.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: Best to pool our knowledge. What do you know about the tadpole?

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: Very little. Supposedly those monsters breed by planting their tadpoles in people's heads.

313.speaker: Shadowheart
313.text: Over time, the infected victim turns into a mind flayer.

293.speaker: Shadowheart
293.text: I don't remember how long it takes, but we should hurry.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I've never met an elf - half or otherwise - with such an enticing name.
50.context: NodeContext: with a smile, a little flirtatious

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: I've never met a drow with a sense of humour. Perhaps we'll get along.
78.context: NodeContext: with a smile, a little flirtatious

144.text: I heard you. So now hear me: raise a single hand against me, and I will slice it clean off.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I heard you. So now hear me: raise a single hand against me, and I will slice it clean off.

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: I heard you. So now hear me: raise a single hand against me, and I will slice it clean off.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Save your breath - I'm going nowhere with you as long as you have that gith in tow.

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Save your breath - I'm going nowhere with you as long as you have that gith in tow.

344.speaker: Shadowheart
344.text: Perhaps I'll find your corpse by the road.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: Look around - do you really have any better prospects?

185.speaker: Shadowheart
185.text: Go on, then. Just don't be surprised when your friend turns on you.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I'm not going to just abandon my companion on a whim.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Your loyalty is noted but not commended.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: Your loyalty is noted but not commended.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: Fine, put your faith in a marauding freak. Just do it away from me.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: Fine, put your faith in a marauding freak. Just do it away from me.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: I'll bleed you dry if you continue to insult me.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: Was that a threat? It was a bit toothless. You're out of your element here, I think.

368.speaker: Player
368.text: I'm leaving before more things crawl out of the wreckage.

295.speaker: Shadowheart
295.text: Likewise. Try killing a couple of these monsters before you die - lessens the load for me.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What you're making is a racket. That noise is bound to attract attention.
32.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if a barbarian player failed to use brute force to free SH during the tutorial.

322.speaker: Shadowheart
322.text: It already has. These things here didn't die in their sleep.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: I have lockpicks - let me try.
271.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if a barbarian player failed to use brute force to free SH during the tutorial.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Stand aside. My rage can shatter anything.
153.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if a barbarian player failed to use brute force to free SH during the tutorial.

343.speaker: Shadowheart
343.text: Apart from my pod, remember? I'm grateful for the effort, but you should save your strength.
343.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if a barbarian player failed to use brute force to free SH during the tutorial.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Don't waste your energy on that door. Our captors might still be crawling about.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: I can handle myself - but you're right. Time to try something else.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: I'm going to see what's at the top of this cliff.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes look up briefly contemplate the bluffs overhead.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Have you considered sparing your arm and picking the lock? Seems the sort of thing I'd have open in no time.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Brute strength is nothing to my magical skill - allow me to blast it open.

278.speaker: Lae'zel
278.text: Their duty was survival. You'd have done the same - do not pretend otherwise.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Yes, I felt this before, with another escapee from that ship.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: If I were to guess, the things they put in our eyes.

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: We'll need to find a healer to help us.

311.speaker: Shadowheart
311.text: But first, we'll need to survive the wilderness. I'd hoped there might be useful supplies through here.

195.speaker: Shadowheart
195.text: But no luck getting in so far.

282.speaker: Shadowheart
282.text: But it seems you've beaten me to it.

331.speaker: Shadowheart
331.text: Wait. It's you... you're the one who tried to free me, on the ship.
331.context: CinematicNodeContext: Body language eases a little, recognising there's no immediate dangerNodeContext: Recognition. She lowers her guard as she realises the player's not an immediate threat - in fact, they'd tried to help her in a life or death situation previously.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: At least you made the effort.

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Confusion. Resolve. And a hint of gratitude.*

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: ... agh! Did you feel that? You've got the same thing I do - in your head.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: Blasted door! I - what? Stop! Not another step or I'll...
184.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Look-at: Shadowheart is concentrated on the doors for the first part, then spots the player from 'Stop!' - turning her attention to them, aggressive.NodeContext: Shadowheart is focused on getting through a sealed door, when she hears the player's approach the turns quickly do see who is there
She trails off as she realises she recognises us from earlier... trying to put a name to the face.
(Had she completed her last line, it would have been 'not another step or I'll leave you bleeding out on this sand'.)

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: Wait. You... you're one of that lot who were attacking the ship.
90.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Narrows her eyes accusingly.NodeContext: Recognition. Narrows her eyes accusingly.
This isn't just some random potential threat approaching, but a gith, whose kind she sees of as a threat to her interests.

276.speaker: Narrator
276.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Distrust. Hostility. Because you are gith.*

299.speaker: Shadowheart
299.text: ... agh! No, you were on the ship, captive. I can feel the parasite in your head.

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: You tried to get my pod open, didn't you?

347.speaker: Shadowheart
347.text: ... probably wanted to kill me and loot my corpse. Don't come any closer.

326.speaker: Player
326.text: Use your sense. If I wanted to harm you, my blade would be through your throat.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: Is everyone on Faerûn mad, or is this your singular affliction?

288.speaker: Player
288.text: Hold your tongue, or I will slice it out.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: You'll breath your last before you lay a single finger on me!

253.speaker: Shadowheart
253.text: I've seen your kind's handiwork. And I won't fall victim to it. Get away!

3.speaker: Player
3.text: My kind was attacking the enemy. You don't look like the enemy to me.

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: Maybe I have other reasons. Either way, come any closer and I will kill you.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Wouldn't diplomacy be a bit more logical?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: The ghaik tadpole is the true threat. Not me.

220.speaker: Shadowheart
220.text: All right... say you didn't leave and we didn't come to blows... what then?

249.speaker: Shadowheart
249.text: All right... say you didn't leave and we didn't come to blows... what then?

131.speaker: Player
131.text: We will survive together and be stronger for it.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: I suppose there's plenty of other things that're set on killing me around here...

267.speaker: Shadowheart
267.text: ... fine. But understand that I'll cut you loose the moment I have to.

4.text: I don't care what words come out of your mouth, gith. You have your choices.

345.speaker: Shadowheart
345.text: I don't care what words come out of your mouth, gith. You have your choices.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Good. Now keep going, and if you see me again, go the opposite direction.

325.speaker: Player
325.text: You are free to strike the first blow - but I will strike the last.

317.speaker: Player
317.text: Divide and conquer is a time-tested strategy. Will you walk into your own defeat?

234.speaker: Player
234.text: There is fire in you - violence. We would make a formidable pair.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Call her bluff and step closer.

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: And you ran away as I recall. Left me to die, trapped in a pod while we tumbled through Hell.

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: Well, now you can run away again, gith. Keep back!

297.speaker: Shadowheart
297.text: No matter. Walk away, gith. Not a step closer!

362.speaker: Narrator
362.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Distrust. Hostility. Because you look like a gith.*

212.speaker: Shadowheart
212.text: ... agh! No, you just look like one. That's a good way to get yourself killed, idiot.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I hope that's not a threat. What's your problem?

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: Did you forget how we wound up here? Those dragon-riding reavers tried to kill us!

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: Never mind... there's bigger problems than your terrible taste in disguises.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: The githyanki are hardly common here - I'm surprised you can bear such hatred for them?

211.speaker: Shadowheart
211.text: I told you already - I want to speak to whoever's really in charge.
211.context: NodeContext: Recognition. She's still on her guard, unsure of whether the player's intentions, and how they survived the crash.

321.speaker: Shadowheart
321.text: Wait... it's you. I saw you on the ship. You survived, then.
321.context: NodeContext: Recognition. She's still on her guard, unsure of whether the player's intentions, and how they survived the crash.

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Anger. Confusion. Resolve.*
151.context: InternalNodeContext: Psionic mind meld moment - the player and Shadowheart swap perspective for a brief moment.

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: ... agh!  You - you've got the same thing I do, in your head. I felt it.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures to her head as she says 'a little preoccupied' - referring to the tadpoling.

361.speaker: Player
361.text: I didn't feel a thing. No idea what you're talking about.
361.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures to her head as she says 'a little preoccupied' - referring to the tadpoling.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I remember you. You survived those monsters' pod then?
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures to her head as she says 'a little preoccupied' - referring to the tadpoling.

206.speaker: Shadowheart
206.text: Yes. And they put a tadpole in my eye too. I assume that's what caused our minds to... cross.
206.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gestures to her head as she says 'a little preoccupied' - referring to the tadpoling.

332.speaker: Shadowheart
332.text: But that's the least of our problems.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: You were kidnapped by those creatures as well?

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Say nothing and stare at her. You're so hungry.

274.speaker: Shadowheart
274.text: What's the matter with you? Has that tadpole scrambled your brain already?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Nothing's wrong! Just a bit of... fuzzy memory.

248.speaker: Shadowheart
248.text: Come on. The chase through Hell? The creatures? What they did to us? The tadpoles?

314.speaker: Shadowheart
314.text: These things are going to consume us from the inside and turn us into mind flayers.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: That mind swap - I experienced it before, on the ship. You felt it too?

336.speaker: Shadowheart
336.text: The same. It must be that tadpole they put in our eyes. I assume that's what caused our minds to... cross.

312.speaker: Player
312.text: How far back did you see? Do you know what I am?

366.speaker: Shadowheart
366.text: Of course. You're the same as me. You have a mind flayer tadpole in your brain.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Give in to the hunger. Lunge for her neck.

335.speaker: Shadowheart
335.text: What in Shar's name...? Get away from me you rabid freak!

237.speaker: Player
237.text: You've no fear for one of Lolth's Chosen? Curious.

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: Well I'm not most. I respect drow. I've no quarrel with you, unless you make one.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: The drow look is a bit of magic. Think nothing of it.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: A disguise? You could've picked something a little less conspicuous.

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: Anyway, we've both got more pressing concerns - like these tadpoles in each of our heads.

374.speaker: Shadowheart
374.text: ... agh! Seems like you had the same idea as me. Not to mention the same problem. I felt it.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: What the - you were on the ship with me! How did you get inside here...?
339.context: CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: We'll need to show the player exiting the temple and the door swinging open. Make sure the player ends in the same scene location as the other setups.
